metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9676 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The seg_write_packet function in libavformat/segment.c in ffmpeg 2.1.4 and earlier does not free the correct memory location, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service ("invalid memory handler") and possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted video that triggers a use after free. It was discovered that Libav incorrectly handled certain media files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9676` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libav-tools - 6:9.20-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
libavcodec-extra - 6:9.20-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
libavcodec-extra-54 - 6:9.20-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
libavcodec54 - 6:9.20-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
libavdevice-extra-53 - 6:9.20-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
libavdevice53 - 6:9.20-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
libavfilter-extra-3 - 6:9.20-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
libavfilter3 - 6:9.20-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
libavformat-extra-54 - 6:9.20-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
libavformat54 - 6:9.20-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
libavresample1 - 6:9.20-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
libavutil-extra-52 - 6:9.20-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
libavutil52 - 6:9.20-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
libswscale-extra-2 - 6:9.20-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
libswscale2 - 6:9.20-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> from what I can tell, libav 9.0 to 11.1 is affected with upstream git commit eb447d515956b3ce182d9750083131735f00324c introducing the issue

criterions.comment: libav package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6:9.20-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1').
